node.title: Good news for sour lemon lovers with shortage set to end
node.description: Next week Kiwis will be back to having an extra zest in their drinks as suppliers hope to have lemons hitting shelves nationwide.
node.content: ["A lemon shortage in New Zealand supermarkets has left people with a sour taste in their mouths.", "However, next week Kiwis will be back to having an extra zest in their drinks as suppliers hope to have lemons hitting shelves nationwide.", "Lemons are currently out of season and COVID-19 is causing hold-ups for international supply.", "Tom Chamberlain, T&G's regional manager in Kerikeri, said only 20-30 percent of their lemons are grown in Summer.", "\"Typically, our customers (such as the major supermarkets) tend to import lemons to supplement domestic supply to meet demand,\" Chamberlain said. \"However, due to COVID and global supply chain constraints, this is currently a bit difficult, hence the current shortage.\"", "A Countdown spokesperson said supply is \"extremely limited\" and they have had to temporarily remove lemons from the online store to help manage the demand.", "\"As lemons are a winter crop, local supply is extremely limited at the moment,\" Countdown said in a statement. \"We do currently have a mix of local and imported fruit in our stores, however, demand is really high.\"", "A spokesperson for Foodstuffs, which owns and operates New World and PAK'nSAVE supermarket, said its imported lemons are late.", "\"If you see a gap on the supermarket shelf and it's not currently in season in NZ, it's likely to have been held up on the boat and will be back soon,\" Foodstuffs corporate affairs manager Emma Wooster told the NZ Herald.", "But it's not all bad news. Chamberlain said the T&G team are picking 30 tonnes of Kerikeri-grown lemons and they'll be available for consumers in supermarkets nationwide throughout next week.", "The Countdown spokesperson said it also has lemons hitting the shelves soon, with a shipment from the US hopefully received by the end of next week."]
